subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: A small note on the Unicode proposal
msgSnippet: I believe the purpose for underlining numbers as mentioned in the Manual was to insure that they were not mistaken for QS letters in handwritten
messageBody:
I believe the purpose for underlining numbers as mentioned in the Manual
was to insure that they were not mistaken for QS letters in handwritten
communications. While that might be a concern if one's handwriting is
sloppy, I doubt we need to worry about it when using computer fonts. I
agree with Oliver that it would serve no purpose to underline numbers,
and we should ignore that suggestion in the manual.

Paige


> oliver langan wrote:
>
>> Alternately, we could decide that the underlining or not of numbers is
>> outside of the scope of the Unicode proposal. I don't like it,
>> myself, and do not follow it when I write (or type) Quickscript:
>> moreover, as you point out it would cause problems with machine
>> parsing of the numbers. I think that the QS manual should be the
>> 'first source' for the alphabet, but I don't think it necessarily
>> needs to be followed slavishly.
>>
>
>
>
>
>
>>
>> Now that I think about it, the underlining could be handled within the
>> font. It would not be true underlining, but it would have a
>> consistent look.
>>
>
>
>
>
>>
>> oliver
>>
